info.title: Reignite MicroVM API
info.description: The Reignite MicroVM API handles operations for provisioning and managing microvms

ID is the identifier of the microvm.
If this empty at creation time a ID will be automatically generated.

HostPathVolumeSourceHostPathType.description: - RAW_FILE: RAW_FILE represents a file on the host to use as a source for a volume. It should be a raw fs.

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

path.description: Path on the host of the file/device to use as a source for a volume.

type.description: Type is the type of file/device on the host.

typesHostPathVolumeSource.description: HostPathVolumeSource represents the details of a volume coming from a file/device on the host.

image.description: Image is the container image to use.

cmdline.description: Cmdline is the kernel command line args.

filename.description:
Filename is used to specify the name of the kernel file
in the Image.

typesKernel.description: Kernel represents the configuration for a kernel.

id.description:
ID is the identifier of the microvm.
If this empty at creation time a ID will be automatically generated.

namespace.description: Namespace is the name of the namespace the microvm belongs to.

labels.description: Labels allows you to include extra data for the microvms.

vcpu.description: VCPU specifies how many vcpu the machine will be allocated.

memoryInMb.description: MemoryInMb is the amount of memory in megabytes that the machine will be allocated.

kernel.description: Kernel is the details of the kernel to use .

initrdImage.description: Initrd_image is the container image to use for the initial ramdisk.

volumes.description:
Volumes specifies the volumes to be attached to the microvm. There must be
at lease one volume that will act as the root volume.

interfaces.description: Interfaces specifies the network interfaces to be attached to the microvm.

createdAt.description: CreatedAt indicates the time the microvm was created at.

updatedAt.description: UpdatedAt indicates the time the microvm was last updated.

typesMicroVMSpec.description: MicroVMSpec represents the specification for a microvm.

allowMetadataReq.description: AllowMetadataReq indicates if the network interface allows metadata requests.

guestMac.title:
GuestMAC allows the specifying of a specifi MAC address to use for the interface. If
not supplied a autogenerated MAC address will be used.y

guestDeviceName.title:
GuestDeviceName is the name of the network interface to create in the microvm. If this
is not supplied than a device name will be assigned automatically

id.description: ID is the uinique identifier of the volume.

isRoot.description:
IsRoot specifies that the volume is to be used as the root volume. A machine
must have a root volume.

isReadOnly.description: IsReadOnly specifies that the volume is to be mounted readonly.

mountPoint.description: MountPoint is the mount point for the volume in the microvm.

source.description: Source is where the volume will be sourced from.

partitionId.description: PartitionID is the uuid of the boot partition.

sizeInMb.description: Size is the size to resize this volume to.

typesVolume.description: Volume represents the configuration for a volume to be attached to a microvm.

containerSource.description: Container is used to specify a source of a volume as a OCI container.

hostpathSource.description: HostPath is used to specify a source of a volume as a file/device on the host.

typesVolumeSource.description: VolumeSource is the source of a volume. Based loosely on the volumes in Kubernetes Pod specs.
